headline: Not a great online course platform at…
reviewBody: Not a great online course platform at all. Ok, most are free, but you do not get much benefit from the courses. At least in my experience.

headline: Beware this organisation.......
reviewBody: I did step one of the course then found out I had to pay twenty pounds for the certificate, which I have not received. Every time I try to get into step two it tells me my details are not correct. It wont let me reset my password though.  Nobody answers my emails and they don't give a telephone number for contact.  In fact it says on their website we cannot contact them other than email.  I got in touch with someone from the NHS as this is an NHS course being run by Future Learn, who in turn got someone from Future Learn to send me an email.  I replied, but have heard nothing since. Its been several days now that I have tried to get back on site to finish my course.  A complete waste of time.  If this is not a scam it is at the very least a shoddily run business.

headline: Excellent courses
reviewBody: I have completed about 18 future learn courses during the pandemic and enjoyed all but one.  The interaction with the other students was a life-line to those of us living alone.  There was only one course that I didn't like as there was too much filling up material which was totally unnecessary.  Apart from that they were all excellent. I have two more lined up to study in the immediate future.

headline: I signed up for a course which was…
reviewBody:
I signed up for a course which was advertised as free. I spent the time doing the learning (~4 hours). It was not until I got to the end of this time that I found you could not do the final module quiz or get a certificate without paying.
I wouldn't have wasted my time doing the module if I knew thaf couldn't complete it.
I think it very dishonest that it is not made clear at the start that you need to pay. (Especially as a week of thee course I was doing was about respect!)
Please be careful.

headline: first month
reviewBody: just trying this platforms for 1 month and its very good

headline: Preaching not Learning
reviewBody:
I tried to respond and comment on the course I signed up to but was blocked. That to me is preaching NOT learning.

It also became evident to  me very early on in the course that it was the antithesis of what I was expecting. However no follow up by FL, no "how is it going for you? "or did it meet your expectations?"

Fortuately it was FREE so I am off to look for a better quality course elsewhere.

headline: Great for me, but maybe not for everyone.
reviewBody:
This is a useful and interesting place for me to learn new things and dip my toe into areas of study that are new to me. However, I am retired, hold two doctorates in my own fields and have no need of professional advancement. It seems that those who perhaps need reasonably priced access to courses that will help them professionally are not receiving what they need or expect - I say this because of the experiences of family members, not from the perspective of other people commenting here.
So, Future Learn suits me perfectly, but perhaps not everyone else. I noticed the information about being able to download a certification on one course I took came at the end of all the work put in, not early on. Busy, working people with children can't necessarily afford time to complete courses they then have no proof of having done. On the other hand, it would be easy for anyone to scroll through, click to say they had completed units they hadn't read and then award themselves a certificate, so perhaps a written piece needs to be submitter first, which would inevitably involve cost, but then, this is a business!

headline: use a different education provider
reviewBody:
recently signed up for a free cyber course started the course then realised a few questions in that I would now have to pay £62 for a certificate and even to do any assessments on the ad on reed stated you only had to pay if you wanted longer access to the course.
as someone else has said there were a lot of pop up's as well would not use this education provider again.
has made me wary of doing a free course again I think future learn is a bit of a con.

headline: While I agree that most of the free…
reviewBody: While I agree that most of the free AdHoc courses on this site are absolutely fine.  I have been very let down by a Machine Learning course, that to be honest was well below the standards I would have expected from a company like FutureLearn.  Then when they moved me to a new course, was let down at 5.20 on the working day before the course was due to start.  Being an accredited professional, have been very let down and have really given me alot to catch up through lost time for my expected CPD.  Beware of paid courses, as it seems thats where the issue is here.

headline: Scam
reviewBody: Please read!!!!! The main site is brilliant and all education is great. I'm giving the one star to warn people about the app. There is not one. I have been in contact with future learn and they now know people are pretending to be them. If you see the app do not download. Do not give login details or card details.

headline: Refund policy
reviewBody:
Refund policy
I found the courses on psychology excellent, but I am experiencing some delay and difficulties with my request for refund, just one day after purchasing.
I believe future learn could improve customer service.
Still waiting on the refund!

headline: Truly disappointing courses
reviewBody: Truly disappointing courses, a complete waste of my effort, nothing I didn't know already... You only teach dictionary definitions of what is what (you can google all of it btw), but not how to actually work in the chosen type of job. It's like learning the definition of the word "finances"... good for you now you know what it is, but you cannot find a job in the finances. Go to any market broker and tell them that you would like a job because you know what the definition of their job is. NO REAL KNOWLEDGE WILL BE GAINED FROM THEM!

headline: lucky escape from this awful  company
reviewBody: i was considering doing a course and even paying for one but i think i got a really lucky escape future learn is a sham for reals it would hack into my connection over flow it and then when i came back to log in it said invalid email or password this isnt the first time it did this it does this on a constant basis not once it will do this once every time i even get into it and i have had enough deleted my account i was considering paying for the free course i was viewing but if i left a comment they didnt like and cos i was a free learner they would fk everything up even my connection then block me from my account oh no ya dont deleted really the worst free piece of sh!t i have ever encountered !!! whats more is im so glad i didnt give these con artists any money at all after reading the reviews im lucky i didnt even bother lucky for me they didnt get a dime/pound

headline: I enrolled microcredential course (Data Analytics for Business Fundamentals Microcredential course)
reviewBody:
I enrolled microcredential course at Futurelear. Initally, I gave a lot of benefit of the doubt but as time goes, I really regret using this platform. There are two parts: Co-ordinator outside of the course, educators or facilitators in the course.

Co-ordinator
- Never response back (if they respond, you might have followed up a minimum 10 times)
- lack of structural communication and accountability 

Educator
This part is crucial.
The way Futureture learn works; 
Course developed by somebody (University cannot confirm)
And educators are just facilitators.

I found that educators are
- not prepare enough to understand where the course goes
- hosting webinar only, no structure, no approach, and strategy on how to get the final output.
- not involved in quality of output and content

These are heads up for you. I previously did such courses in other platforms, my experience, I really regret signing up the course.

headline: I joined their ‘unlimited’ subscription…
reviewBody: I joined their ‘unlimited’ subscription last week subject to their 14 day cooling off period and due to a change of personal circumstances, I no longer want this. They are refusing to refund this amount because I continued a free course which I had started prior to subscribing.

headline: a beautiful learning experience
reviewBody:
The translation course I had by Cardiff university was beautifully done. You can see the effort put into each unit and how it all comes together to provide you with actual knowledge regarding translation. It was thought-provoking, interesting, and fun.
Courses online usually get pretty boring quickly and you push yourself through them for your cv, this certainly wasn't the case and I loved every minute of it.
That said, I haven't paid for the certificate, some people mentioned that it's not accredited, so keep that in mind. Nonetheless, a beautiful learning experience.

headline: Issue with certificates
reviewBody:
Guys It is Important to be absolutely sure what you get out of the courses you do before paying in this website. Paid for a course did it and passed test. First you have to go through Id verification otherwise your certificate will say the I'd has not been verified. Second my certificate says .... ''The certificate and transcript do not imply
the award of credit or the conferment of a qualification from University
of Leeds and National Institute for Health Research''...the course was clearly by NIHR and University   if Leeds I was not warned or told about this .. Is there any value in this certificate?

Look at this from Futurelearn; 
 
Is FutureLearn accredited?
All certificates state the minimum number of hours required per week and the length of the course, so you can claim that many hours of CPD (Continuing Professional Development) by showing your employer or organisation the certificate.

The majority of learners who purchase them add them to their CV, but it's important to note that certificates do not imply the award of credit points or the conferment of a university qualification.

Where a course or program is accredited this information will be included on the course  .... this is from futurelearn website.

I paid 62 pounds for a non accredited course!!! 
If you want knowledge and scroll courses free.....it may be good for you otherwise it's a ripoff. Unfortunately if YOU HAVE TAKEN THE TEST OR RECIEVED  A DIGITAL  / ORIGINAL PAPER CERTIFICATE you can not claim back the money!!!!

So please ensure that you know what you are paying for. You have been warned.

headline: 4 stars for me!
reviewBody:
This Reiview is regarding the Song writing course. 

I love how this course was free but their are some areas of improvement. 
- the course is a bit well,...... weird?! its just got too many buttons to press so it can be very confusing ! 
- The course is too long! 
Other than that I've absouloutly loved it. Its an 8 week course and MAYBE I could benefit from doing the whole course but for me I've only done one week and I've already written my song so it seems to be enough for me. I've picked up bits of info to make my song great!

headline: Interesting courses
reviewBody: They have a range of interesting courses to help you progress professionally or personally. It’s great that they teach you with videos and articles. Only thing i would say is that the certificates can be quite expensive (between £30-£50)

headline: This is a great education platform
reviewBody: This is a great education platform. I learnt forensic science and archeology very helpful staff and they have plenty of courses to choose from.

headline: I completed elementary English 😁…
reviewBody:
I completed elementary English 😁 course 
 Finally I can write and speak a English some what in properly . Thank future learn

headline: The most learners-friendly platform.
reviewBody: Probably, the most comfortable and learners-friendly platform. I really love the culture and language courses here, especially those ones provided by the British Council. One tip: try not to get behind on your learning, as it is far more interesting to interact with tutors and moderators.

headline: Excellent
reviewBody: Excellent, free education certified by universities. Lots of extra information and links in downloadable resources. Great comments and perspectives from other learners all over the world.

headline: FutureLearn Review
reviewBody: FutureLearn offer many free online courses. Hope it can offer other courses like Javascript, wordpress and etc in the future. Overall I love FutureLearn so much.

headline: I did an online book keeping course and…
reviewBody:
I did an online book keeping course and upgraded so I could take the test.

The test questions was not explained properly and I got 6 out of the 9 questions right, They deemed this as an average of 48% which is not correct and didn't receive a certificate. 

I paid £44 to sit this test don't waste your money.

headline: I have completed about 4 free courses…
reviewBody: I have completed about 4 free courses on future learn relating to education and environment. I have found all courses professional, well presented and allow for discussion amongst fellow students about the topic presented. I think the topics chosen are up to date and very relevant. My only concern is how well a potential employer may regard the certificate. Whilst it's not a degree or post grad, I think it would be considered as evidence of professional development and have some credence.

headline: I paid for 2 courses.....
reviewBody: I paid for 2 courses as I was advised I would obtain credits for the GDP in psychology at Monash if I was to further my education- there was no mentioned of needing a bachelor of psychology at all on that website. I was lucky to discuss this with the enrolment officer at Monash who advised that he has not even heard of future learn at all and told me that they should have advised me I needed a bachelor before I could obtain credits for he GDP!! Rip off don’t do it

headline: Unfortunately
reviewBody:
Unfortunately , i discovered a trick recently. upon upgrade the  some courses they will denied you to get the certificate with argument (you did not pass the test). The answers consist of   three options of four (true) and the fourth option is partially correct)  and you are not allowed to retake the test and  the payment page there is no instructions on upgrade terms  . 

They do not pay attention for complaints , (no more trust !)

headline: So many interesting studies
reviewBody: So many interesting studies, I wish I could learn them all but I lack time. This is a great platform to easily expand your knowledge and won’t cost you anything. I have done over 10 courses here and the quality is pretty high while the information is very easy to understand. Complete with videos and helpful graphics. Especially nice for people like me who are constantly hungry to learn something new.

headline: Great Platform
reviewBody: I think this is a great resource. I am glad to have learned about it, and think it will be a good help for everyone. Try it and you will be convinced.

headline: A great place to learn new skills from top tutors to improve your job prospects and your mind
reviewBody:
This is great site with a wide variety of courses run by top industry organisations where you can improve your job prospects and skills or just learn more about your interests or exercise those brain cells.
The courses are mainly free but you can choose to pay for certificates when you pass.
The learning style is fun, easy to follow and can be done at a time that suits you. The courses my daughter has done on it taught her valuable practical skills through her course tasks. The mentors give feedback and help and most sections of the course have a comments answer board which you fill in but where you can also share ideas and chat to other students that you follow.
This is a great educational site for anyone who prefers to work in their own time or needs to fit a course around work.
I hope they bring even more courses and universities on soon, and I am looking forward to starting a course with them too soon.

headline: Exciting and fun introduction to forensic anthropology
reviewBody: For those of us lucky enough to have about four hours a week to spend learning, future learn offers many many courses in all subjects. I've just completed the first week and have really enjoyed the mix of spoken script, video and real life scenario to introduce the subject. And get this, it's free!!!
